title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (http://contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

title: Contributing to tradestatistics
text: outlines propose change tradestatistics. detailed info contributing , tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide.

title: Contributing to tradestatistics
text: Small typos grammatical errors documentation may edited directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. YES: edit roxygen comment .R file R/. : edit .Rd file man/.

title: Contributing to tradestatistics
text: make substantial pull request, always file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s problem. ’ve found bug, create associated issue illustrate bug minimal reprex.

title: Contributing to tradestatistics
text: recommend create Git branch pull request (PR). Look Travis AppVeyor build status making changes. README contain badges continuous integration services used package. New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat. Contributions test cases included easier accept. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md current development version header describing changes made followed GitHub username, links relevant issue(s)/PR(s).

title: Contributing to tradestatistics
text: Please note tradestatistics project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Contributing to tradestatistics
text: details.

title: Basic usage
text: vignette explains functions within package. idea show package simplifies obtaining data (api.tradestatistics.io)[https://api.tradestatistics.io]. improve presentation tables shall use tibble besides tradestatistics.
code: library(tradestatistics) library(tibble)

title: Basic usage
text: Provided package obtains data API, useful know tables can accessed: might notice tables pattern. letters indicate presence columns account level detail data: y: year column. r: reporter column p: partner column c: commodity column aggregated table yr basically says many dollars country exports imports given year. less aggregated table yrpc says many dollars 1,242 commodities Harmonized System country exports countries imports countries. complete detail can check tradestatistics.io.
code: as_tibble(ots_tables) #> # A tibble: 16 × 3 #>    table             description                                          source #>    <chr>             <chr>                                                <chr>  #>  1 commodities       Commodities metadata (HS codes, 6 digits long)       UN Co… #>  2 commodities_short Commodities metadata (HS codes, 4 digits long)       UN Co… #>  3 countries         Countries metadata                                   UN Co… #>  4 distances         Distance between countries, alongside continuity, c… CEPII… #>  5 partners          Partners for a given year                            UN Co… #>  6 reporters         Reporters for a given year                           UN Co… #>  7 sections          Sections metadata (HS codes)                         UN Co… #>  8 sections_colors   Colors for sections (i.e. useful to visualize data)  Open … #>  9 rtas              Regional Trade Agreements per pair of countries and… Desig… #> 10 tariffs           Most Favoured Nation tarrifs (Year, Reporter and Co… World… #> 11 years             Minimum and maximum years with available data        Open … #> 12 yc                Commodity trade at aggregated level (Year and Commo… Open … #> 13 yr                Reporter trade at aggregated level (Year and Report… Open … #> 14 yrc               Reporter trade at commodity level (Year, Reporter a… Open … #> 15 yrp               Reporter-Partner trade at aggregated level (Year, R… Open … #> 16 yrpc              Reporter-Partner trade at commodity level (Year, Re… Open …

title: Basic usage
text: Package Functions section explains don’t need memorize ISO codes. functions within package designed match strings (.e. “United States” “America”) valid ISO codes (.e. “USA”). Just reference, table valid ISO codes can accessed running :
code: as_tibble(ots_countries) #> # A tibble: 264 × 5 #>    country_iso country_name_english country_fullname_english continent_id #>    <chr>       <chr>                <chr>                           <int> #>  1 dza         Algeria              Algeria                             3 #>  2 ago         Angola               Angola                              3 #>  3 ben         Benin                Benin                               3 #>  4 bwa         Botswana             Botswana                            3 #>  5 bfa         Burkina Faso         Burkina Faso                        3 #>  6 bdi         Burundi              Burundi                             3 #>  7 cmr         Cameroon             Cameroon                            3 #>  8 cpv         Cape Verde           Cape Verde                          3 #>  9 caf         Central African Rep. Central African Rep.                3 #> 10 tcd         Chad                 Chad                                3 #> # ℹ 254 more rows #> # ℹ 1 more variable: continent_name_english <chr>

title: Basic usage
text: Package Functions section explains don’t need memorize HS codes. functions within package designed match strings (.e. “apple”) valid HS codes (.e. “0808”).
code: as_tibble(ots_commodities) #> # A tibble: 5,304 × 4 #>    commodity_code commodity_fullname_english section_code section_fullname_eng…¹ #>    <chr>          <chr>                      <chr>        <chr>                  #>  1 010121         Horses; live, pure-bred b… 01           Live animals and anim… #>  2 010129         Horses; live, other than … 01           Live animals and anim… #>  3 010130         Asses; live                01           Live animals and anim… #>  4 010190         Mules and hinnies; live    01           Live animals and anim… #>  5 010221         Cattle; live, pure-bred b… 01           Live animals and anim… #>  6 010229         Cattle; live, other than … 01           Live animals and anim… #>  7 010231         Buffalo; live, pure-bred … 01           Live animals and anim… #>  8 010239         Buffalo; live, other than… 01           Live animals and anim… #>  9 010290         Bovine animals; live, oth… 01           Live animals and anim… #> 10 010310         Swine; live, pure-bred br… 01           Live animals and anim… #> # ℹ 5,294 more rows #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​section_fullname_english

title: Basic usage
text: table provided used ots_gdp_deflator_adjustment().

title: Basic usage
text: end user can use function find ISO code providing country name. works implementing partial search. Basic examples: function ots_country_code() used ots_create_tidy_data() way can pass parameters like ots_create_tidy_data(... reporters = "Chile" ...) automatically replace input valid ISO case match. covered detail Trade Data section.
code: # Single match with no replacement as_tibble(ots_country_code("Chile")) #> # A tibble: 1 × 5 #>   country_iso country_name_english country_fullname_english continent_id #>   <chr>       <chr>                <chr>                           <int> #> 1 chl         Chile                Chile                               5 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: continent_name_english <chr>  # Single match with replacement as_tibble(ots_country_code("America")) #> # A tibble: 1 × 5 #>   country_iso country_name_english country_fullname_english         continent_id #>   <chr>       <chr>                <chr>                                   <int> #> 1 usa         USA                  USA, Puerto Rico and US Virgin …            5 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: continent_name_english <chr>  # Double match with no replacement as_tibble(ots_country_code("Germany")) #> # A tibble: 1 × 5 #>   country_iso country_name_english country_fullname_english         continent_id #>   <chr>       <chr>                <chr>                                   <int> #> 1 deu         Germany              Germany (former Federal Republi…            2 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: continent_name_english <chr>

title: Basic usage
text: end user can find code set codes looking keywords commodities groups. function ots_commodity_code() allows search official commodities groups Harmonized system:
code: as_tibble(ots_commodity_code(commodity = " ShEEp ", section = " mEaT ")) #> # A tibble: 0 × 4 #> # ℹ 4 variables: commodity_code <chr>, commodity_fullname_english <chr>, #> #   section_code <chr>, section_fullname_english <chr>

title: Basic usage
text: function downloads data single year needs (least) filter parameters according query type. cover aggregated tables describe usage.

what: Bilateral trade at commodity level (Year - Reporter - Partner - Commodity Code)
title: Basic usage
text: want Chile-Argentina bilateral trade community level 2019: can pass two years , several reporters/partners, filter commodities exact codes code matching based keywords: yrpc table returns fields deserve explanation can seen tradestatistics.io. example interesting “01” return set commodities (commodities starting 01, commodity group “Animals; live”), “food” return commodities matching description (“1601”, “1806”, “1904”, etc.). addition, requested commodities exported reporter partner, therefore warning returned.
code: yrpc <- ots_create_tidy_data(   years = 2019,   reporters = "chl",   partners = "arg",   table = "yrpc" )  as_tibble(yrpc) # Note that here I'm passing Peru and not per which is the ISO code for Peru # The same applies to Brazil yrpc2 <- ots_create_tidy_data(   years = 2018:2019,   reporters = c("chl", "Peru", "bol"),   partners = c("arg", "Brazil"),   commodities = c("01", "food"),   table = "yrpc" )

what: Bilateral trade at aggregated level (Year - Reporter - Partner)
title: Basic usage
text: want Chile-Argentina bilateral trade aggregated level 2018 2019: table accepts different years, reporters partners just like yrpc.
code: yrp <- ots_create_tidy_data(   years = 2018:2019,   reporters = c("chl", "per"),   partners = "arg",   table = "yrp" )

what: Reporter trade at commodity level (Year - Reporter - Commodity Code)
title: Basic usage
text: want Chilean trade commodity level 2019 respect commodity “010121” means “Horses; live, pure-bred breeding animals”: table accepts different years, reporters commodity codes just like yrpc. variables table documented tradestatistics.io.
code: yrc <- ots_create_tidy_data(   years = 2019,   reporters = "chl",   commodities = "010121",   table = "yrc" )

what: Reporter trade at aggregated level (Year - Reporter)
title: Basic usage
text: want aggregated trade Chile, Argentina Peru 2018 2019: table accepts different years reporters just like yrpc. variables table documented tradestatistics.io.
code: yr <- ots_create_tidy_data(   years = 2018:2019,   reporters = c("chl", "arg", "per"),   table = "yr" )

what: Commodity trade at aggregated level (Year - Commodity Code)
title: Basic usage
text: want commodities traded 2019: want traded values commodity “010121” means “Horses; live, pure-bred breeding animals” 2019: table accepts different years just like yrpc.
code: yc <- ots_create_tidy_data(   years = 2019,   table = "yc" ) yc2 <- ots_create_tidy_data(   years = 2019,   commodities = "010121",   table = "yc" )

title: Basic usage
text: Taking yr table , can use ots_gdp_deflator_adjustment() convert dollars 2018 2019 dollars 2000:
code: inflation <- ots_gdp_deflator_adjustment(yr, reference_year = 2000) as_tibble(inflation)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Vargas M (2024). tradestatistics: Open Trade Statistics API Wrapper Utility Program. R package version 4.5.0, https://docs.ropensci.org/tradestatistics/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {tradestatistics: Open Trade Statistics API Wrapper and Utility Program},   author = {Mauricio Vargas},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 4.5.0},   url = {https://docs.ropensci.org/tradestatistics/}, }

what: Open Trade Statistics API Wrapper and Utility Program
title: Open Trade Statistics API Wrapper and Utility Program
text: Open Trade Statistics effort open international trade data. tradestatistics provides easy way obtain data OTS accessing API. package : Data diagram Using tradestatistics package efficiency, without package obtain data API expense using additional time effort results. API wrapper utility program package makes data obtaining faster easier .

title: Open Trade Statistics API Wrapper and Utility Program
code: # Install stable version from CRAN install.packages("tradestatistics")  # Install stable version from GitHub devtools::install_github("ropensci/tradestatistics")

title: Open Trade Statistics API Wrapper and Utility Program
text: Please note project released Contributor Code Conduct. participating project agree abide terms.

what: Caching wrapper to reduce API calls (internal) — ots_cache
title: Caching wrapper to reduce API calls (internal) — ots_cache
text: Eases saving data downloaded api.tradestatistics.io prevents ots_read_from_api() downloading twice.

title: Caching wrapper to reduce API calls (internal) — ots_cache
code: ots_cache(use_cache, file, ...)

title: Caching wrapper to reduce API calls (internal) — ots_cache
text: use_cache Logical save load cache. TRUE, results cached memory file NULL disk `file` NULL. file Character full file path save data. ... Additional parameters inherited ots_create_tidy_data().

title: OTS Commodities — ots_commodities
text: Official commodity names Harmonized System rev 2012 (HS12, six digits detail).

title: OTS Commodities — ots_commodities
code: ots_commodities

title: OTS Commodities — ots_commodities
text: data frame 5,304 observations following 4 variables commodity_codeCode every commodity (e.g. 010110) commodity_fullname_englishHS commodity names (e.g. 'Horses, asses, mules hinnies; live, pure-bred breeding animals') section_codeSection code (e.g. 01) section_fullname_english Section name (e.g. 'Live animals animal products')

title: OTS Commodities — ots_commodities
text: Open Trade Statistics

title: OTS Commodities Short — ots_commodities_short
text: Official commodity names Harmonized System rev 2012 (HS12, four digits detail).

title: OTS Commodities Short — ots_commodities_short
code: ots_commodities_short

title: OTS Commodities Short — ots_commodities_short
text: data frame 1,225 observations following 2 variables commodity_codeCode every commodity (e.g. 010110) commodity_fullname_englishHS commodity names (e.g. 'Horses, asses, mules hinnies; live, pure-bred breeding animals') section_codeSection code (e.g. 01) section_fullname_english Section name (e.g. 'Live animals animal products')

title: OTS Commodities Short — ots_commodities_short
text: Open Trade Statistics

String matching of official commodity/section names and Harmonized System (HS) codes
according to the United Nations nomenclature — ots_commodity_code
title:
String matching of official commodity/section names and Harmonized System (HS) codes
according to the United Nations nomenclature — ots_commodity_code
text: Takes text string searches within package data matching commodity codes context valid API commodity codes.

title:
String matching of official commodity/section names and Harmonized System (HS) codes
according to the United Nations nomenclature — ots_commodity_code
code: ots_commodity_code(commodity = NULL, section = NULL)

text: commodity text string "Animals", "COPPER" "fruits". section text string "meat", "FISH" "Dairy".

String matching of official country names and ISO-3 codes according to
the United Nations nomenclature — ots_country_code
code: ots_country_code("Chile ") #>    country_iso country_name_english country_fullname_english continent_id #>         <char>               <char>                   <char>        <int> #> 1:         chl                Chile                    Chile            5 #>    continent_name_english #>                    <char> #> 1:               Americas ots_country_code("america") #>    country_iso country_name_english #>         <char>               <char> #> 1:         usa                  USA #>                                                       country_fullname_english #>                                                                         <char> #> 1: USA, Puerto Rico and US Virgin Islands (excludes Virgin Islands until 1981) #>    continent_id continent_name_english #>           <int>                 <char> #> 1:            5               Americas ots_country_code("UNITED  STATES") #> Empty data.table (0 rows and 5 cols): country_iso,country_name_english,country_fullname_english,continent_id,continent_name_english ots_country_code(" united_") #>    country_iso                 country_name_english #>         <char>                               <char> #> 1:         tza              United Rep. of Tanzania #> 2:         umi United States Minor Outlying Islands #> 3:         are                 United Arab Emirates #> 4:         gbr                       United Kingdom #>                country_fullname_english continent_id continent_name_english #>                                  <char>        <int>                 <char> #> 1:              United Rep. of Tanzania            3                 Africa #> 2: United States Minor Outlying Islands            5               Americas #> 3:                 United Arab Emirates            1                   Asia #> 4:                       United Kingdom            2                 Europe

what: Downloads and processes the data from the API to return a human-readable tibble — ots_create_tidy_data
title: Downloads and processes the data from the API to return a human-readable tibble — ots_create_tidy_data
text: Accesses api.tradestatistics.io performs different API calls transform return tidy data.

title: Downloads and processes the data from the API to return a human-readable tibble — ots_create_tidy_data
code: ots_create_tidy_data(   years = 2019,   reporters = "all",   partners = "all",   commodities = "all",   sections = "all",   table = "yr",   max_attempts = 5,   use_cache = FALSE,   file = NULL )

title: Downloads and processes the data from the API to return a human-readable tibble — ots_create_tidy_data
text: years Year contained within years specified api.tradestatistics.io/year_range (e.g. c(2002,2004), c(2002:2004) 2002). Default set 2019. reporters ISO code reporter country (e.g. "chl", "Chile" c("chl", "Peru")). Default set "". partners ISO code partner country (e.g. "chl", "Chile" c("chl", "Peru")). Default set "". commodities HS commodity codes (e.g. "0101", "01" search matches "apple") filter commodities. Default set "". sections HS section codes (e.g. "01"). Default set "". table Character string select table obtain data. Default set yr (Year - Reporter). Run ots_tables case doubt. max_attempts many times try download data case API internet connection fails obtaining data. Default set 5. use_cache Logical save load cache. TRUE, results cached memory file NULL disk `file` NULL. Default set FALSE. file Optional character full file path save data. Default set NULL.

title: Downloads and processes the data from the API to return a human-readable tibble — ots_create_tidy_data
text: tibble describes bilateral trade metrics (imports, exports, trade balance relevant metrics exports growth w/r last year) reporter partner country.

title: Downloads and processes the data from the API to return a human-readable tibble — ots_create_tidy_data
code: if (FALSE) { # The next examples can take more than 5 seconds to compute, # so these are just shown without evaluation according to CRAN rules  # Run `ots_countries` to display the full table of countries # Run `ots_commodities` to display the full table of commodities  # What does Chile export to China? (2002) ots_create_tidy_data(years = 2002, reporters = "chl", partners = "chn")  # What can we say about Horses export in Chile and the World? (2002) ots_create_tidy_data(years = 2002, commodities = "010110", table = "yc") ots_create_tidy_data(years = 2002, reporters = "chl", commodities = "010110", table = "yrc")  # What can we say about the different types of apples exported by Chile? (2002) ots_create_tidy_data(years = 2002, reporters = "chl", commodities = "apple", table = "yrc") }

what: Expresses tidy data from the API in dollars of a reference year — ots_gdp_deflator_adjustment
title: Expresses tidy data from the API in dollars of a reference year — ots_gdp_deflator_adjustment
text: Uses GDP deflator records World Bank convert trade records express dollars year. records internally subsetted World's values, country specific levels largely re-scale observations reporters reflect unstable macroeconomic policies.

title: Expresses tidy data from the API in dollars of a reference year — ots_gdp_deflator_adjustment
code: ots_gdp_deflator_adjustment(trade_data = NULL, reference_year = NULL)

title: Expresses tidy data from the API in dollars of a reference year — ots_gdp_deflator_adjustment
text: trade_data tibble obtained using ots_create_tidy_data. Default set NULL. reference_year Year contained within years specified api.tradestatistics.io/year_range (e.g. 2010). Default set NULL.

title: Expresses tidy data from the API in dollars of a reference year — ots_gdp_deflator_adjustment
code: if (FALSE) { # The next example can take more than 5 seconds to compute, # so this is shown without evaluation according to CRAN rules  # Convert dollars of 2010 to dollars of 2000 d <- ots_create_tidy_data(years = 2010, reporters = "chl", partners = "chn") ots_gdp_deflator_adjustment(trade_data = d, reference_year = 2000) }

what: tradestatistics: Open Trade Statistics API Wrapper and Utility Program — tradestatistics-package
title: tradestatistics: Open Trade Statistics API Wrapper and Utility Program — tradestatistics-package
text: Access 'Open Trade Statistics' API R download international trade data.

title: tradestatistics: Open Trade Statistics API Wrapper and Utility Program — tradestatistics-package
text: Maintainer: Mauricio Vargas mavargas11@uc.cl (ORCID) [copyright holder] contributors: Joshua Kunst (contributed different parts pre-release code) [contributor] Alexey Kravchenko (reviewed 2021 version API) [contributor] Emma Mendelsohn (updated functions take available years API instead hardcoded values) [contributor] Daniela de los Santos (proposed improvements default parameters) [contributor] Emily Riederer (reviewed package rOpenSci, see https://github.com/ropensci/onboarding/issues/274) [reviewer] Mark Padgham (reviewed package rOpenSci, see https://github.com/ropensci/onboarding/issues/274) [reviewer] Amanda Dobbyn (reviewed previous package evolved current package rOpenSci, see https://github.com/ropensci/onboarding/issues/217) [reviewer] Jorge Cimentada (reviewed previous package evolved current package rOpenSci, see https://github.com/ropensci/onboarding/issues/217) [reviewer] UN Comtrade [data contributor] World Bank [data contributor]

title: version 4.5
text: Reflects changes API therefore reads JSON data. Continues use data.table internals tibble display results nicely. Future versions use tibble require effort.

title: version 4.2
text: Updates * Adds dyadic distances table (ots_distances) gravity modelling Breaking changes * API now returns Parquet files instead JSON cases (except available years tables) * tests adapted reflect changes DB (.e., test “multiple country match = error” longer returns error two codes Germany 2002-2020) * command use_localhost removed Shiny app now connects directly PostgreSQL (.e., saves resources) * column EU-28 member removed countries table (.e., avoid UK confusion Brexit)

title: version 4.1
text: Updates * Uses GDP deflator convert dollars one year another (previously used reported inflation) Breaking changes * New port local instance (8080 -> 4949)

title: version 4.0
text: Updates * Provides ysrpc table visualize products, replacing yc tables. * new default option download imputed data, direct API access raw data. * new method correct import/exports mismatches applied datasets now start 1980 test enough model results older years. * Drops yr-sections yr-groups tables * Drops ‘group’ columns final data (replaces ‘section’ columns) * Allows access raw imputed data API * Allows search special codes API (.e., e-490 codes) * changes resulted large speedups data downloading Open Trade Statistics dashboard Breaking changes * tables API renamed, now made available imputation method remove transportation costs (correct mismatching flows)

title: version 3.0.3
text: Minor fixes * Adds attributes parquet tables (.e., now joins add product name, section color, etc.) Updates * Uses “_name” instead “_fullname_english” final tables colnames

title: version 3.0.2
text: CRAN release: 2022-03-01 Updates * Allows obtain tables Parquet format API, giving speed-~50% final user. * Uses tibble instead DT produce lighter vignettes

title: version 3.0.1
text: Updates * Adds section colors data visualization, taken palette used shiny.tradestatistics.io

title: Version 3.0
text: Updates * Removes references tables using communities short names (unofficial), reflecting changes API * functionality remains , now end user functions don’t add 21-colors palette data (.e. see data section) Data Switches HS92 HS12 reflect product changes less aggregation Drops data Harvard (communities short product names) depend using HS92 4 digits, therefore color palettes removed depended communities table inflation data trimmed window since year 2000 commodities data now contains information +5000 products instead +1200 aggregation level changed API Adds RTAs MFN tariffs gravity modelling

title: Version 2.0
text: Updates Uses ISO codes (affects Aruba, Roumania, Timor-Leste, Antarctica, Saint Barthelemy, Curacao, Sint Maarten South Sudan)

title: Version 1.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-04-03 Updates Reflects API changes less aggregated data Follows UN COMTRADE notation (.e. commodity instead product) impute data hand, better gravity models use cases Provides data exactly API, returning commodity level data allow users aggregation drop reference year inflation adjustment (https://github.com/ropensci/tradestatistics/issues/38) Takes max min available years API instead hardcoded values (https://github.com/ropensci/tradestatistics/pull/39)

title: Version 0.4.0
text: Updates Includes yrpc-ga, yrpc-sa, yrc-ga yr-sa tables reflecting API updates Simplifies end-user functions bit (.e. removes include_groups option) Optimizes code bit, specially joins tables package Fixes codes duplication product group/community match search Includes official shortened section names

title: Version 0.3.1
text: Updates Removes yrp_short option reflecting last DB changes

title: Version 0.3
text: Updates Much improved coverage detect almost possible error Fixes case inflation adjustment year = reference year

title: Version 0.2.8
text: Updates  Includes forwards backwards testing inflation adjustment Testing memory caching

title: Version 0.2.7
text: CRAN release: 2019-12-04 Updates Adds feedback provided @danidlsa Now ots_create_tidy_data() reporter partner set “” default

title: Version 0.2.5
text: CRAN release: 2019-09-19 Updates Added dependency R >= 3.5.0 serialized objects serialize/load version 3 read older versions R Minimal changes ots_create_tidy_data() allow multiple countries arguments, line API changes September 2019

title: Version 0.2.4
text: CRAN release: 2019-09-17 Updates Removes product_code_length API updated simplified parameters 2018 data

title: Version 0.2.3
text: CRAN release: 2019-08-28 Updates Fixtures testthat evaluation Fixes Specific Windows error check

title: Version 0.2.2
text: Adds Inflation data Inflation adjustment function Minor changes vignettes

title: Version 0.2.1
text: Fixes Consistent use colour vs color, color used now Fixed available tables description Adds yrp_short available tables Adds use_localhost option server users want clone database locally, therefore avoid separate branh server installation
